summary: Baku is the capital and biggest city of Azerbaijan, located by the Caspian Sea. It's the lowest-lying capital in the world, 28 meters below sea level. With over two million people, it's the country's biggest city and the main center for science, culture, and industry. Baku is divided into 12 districts and has many historic sites, like the Old City and Maiden Tower, which are UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The city hosts big events like the Eurovision Song Contest and the European Games. It's also known for its strong winds, earning it the nickname "City of Winds."
title: Baku
